headline: Rep. Jim Jordan Slams Biden Over US Oil Production
author: Jeffrey Rodack
sentences:
Rep. Jim Jordan, R-Ohio, accused President Joe Biden of being "afraid" to stand up to Democrats and increase oil production in the U.S.
Jordan made his comments Tuesday during an interview on TV's "Fox & Friends."

And CNN noted that Biden administration officials were in Venezuela during the weekend for talks on potentially permitting that country to sell its oil on the international market as a way to replace Russian oil.
"What that means to middle class families, how that hurts our economy, how that drives up the price of everything because you got — it takes fuel to move goods around the country.
I sat in a hearing … In fact I asked that question when [Rep.] Ro Khanna, [a Democrat member from California] got done badgering these witnesses.
They came as fears mounted the already high gas prices would skyrocket even further due to the Russian invasion of Ukraine.
"Unfortunately, they have complete control of the Democrat Party and Joe Biden, I think, is afraid to stand up to them.
Biden has decided to ban Russian oil imports as a result of the invasion of Ukraine, The Associated Press reported.
Sen. Marco Rubio warned of dealing with Venezuela's socialist leader Nicolás Maduro.
That's why he's talking to Saudi Arabia and Venezuela and Iran, for goodness sake."
He was asked what happens when gas prices go to $8 or $9 a gallon.
So it's complete craziness, but that's where the left is today.
And for the life of me I can't figure out [why].
Jordan replied: "That's what the Democrats want.
I said: 'Do you guys want $8 gas?'
